hr.fer.zemris.edaf.algorithm.eda.independent.hybrid

Class HybridEda

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • hr.fer.zemris.edaf.algorithm.Algorithm
        • hr.fer.zemris.edaf.algorithm.eda.independent.hybrid.HybridEda

  • public class HybridEda
extends Algorithm
    The original objective is to get benefits from both approaches. The main difference from these two evolutionary strategies is how new individuals are generated. These new individuals generated on each generation are called offspring. On one hand, GAs uses crossover and mutation operators as a mechanism to create new individuals from the best individuals of the previous generation. On the other, EDAs builds a probabilistic model with the bests individuals and then sample the model to generate new ones.
    Author:
    Karlo Knezevic, karlo.knezevic@fer.hr
